snippet: The company said it would put procedures in place after the Federal Trade Commission said the site had shared users’ personal information with advertising companies.
abstract: Federal Trade Commission charges Myspace with violating federal law by breaching its promise not to share users' personal information, including their Web browsing habits, with advertising companies; company, without admitting or denying the charge, agrees to a tentative consent order.
lead_paragraph: The company said it would put procedures in place after the Federal Trade Commission said the site had shared users’ personal information with advertising companies.

headline.seo: Myspace Agrees to Privacy Controls Sought by F.T.C.
headline.main: F.T.C. Charges Myspace With Breaking U.S. Law in Sharing Users’ Personal Information
headline.print_headline: F.T.C. Charges Myspace With Breaking U.S. Law in Sharing Users’ Personal Information
